intro: Aphelandra knappiae, commonly known as the Knapp's torch ginger, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Aroid family (Araceae) and is characterized by its striking, elongated inflorescence that resembles a torch. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with a glossy, dark green surface and a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow with red spadices, creating a vivid contrast that attracts pollinators. Aphelandra knappiae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique and eye-catching appearance.
